title: moodleQuiz
text: Moodle, learning management system, store data related quiz taking Moodle Quiz Report 4 types: Grades report, Responses report, Statistic report, Manual grading. moodleQuiz package functions operate specifically 2 types report: Grades report Responses report. notable difference 2 : Grades report columns started Q. x /x, columns store score questions. Responses report columns started Response x, columns store raw text responses questions. rest columns 2 reports: Surname: student’s last name, First name: student’s first name Institution: student’s institution, Department: student’s department Email address: student’s Email (often, educational account) State: state attempt usually 2 values, one : “Finished” submitted attempt, “progress” ongoing -yet-submitted attempt. Started Completed time point student started submitted quiz. Time taken duration started submitted quiz. Grade/xx: total student’s score (present) quiz.

title: moodleQuiz
text: Grades report Responses report can downloaded Moodle server various formats (e.g., .csv, .xlsx, .json). find way import report R data frame list data frames, data structure functions moodleQuiz package operate . imported report R, format clean anything prior passing functions introduce next.

title: moodleQuiz
text: moodleQuiz package comes example data Grade reports Responses reports.
code: library(moodleQuiz) library(dplyr)

title: moodleQuiz
text: grades_ls list containing 3 data frames Moodle Grades Report. elements data frames Grade reports 3 different quiz group students completed. example, Grade report Quiz_1 Notice last row “Overall average” Moodle calculated us.
code: class(grades_ls) #> [1] "list" names(grades_ls) #> [1] "Quiz_1" "Quiz_2" "Quiz_3" head(grades_ls$Quiz_1) #> # A tibble: 6 × 18 #>   Surname `First name` Institution Department `Email address` State `Started on` #>   <chr>   <chr>        <lgl>       <lgl>      <chr>           <chr> <chr>        #> 1 Roquem… Jada         NA          NA         u017@example.c… Fini… 2 June 2021… #> 2 Ali     Ronin        NA          NA         u001@example.c… Fini… 2 June 2021… #> 3 Hoffpa… Jerry        NA          NA         u002@example.c… Fini… 2 June 2021… #> 4 Babbitt Nathan       NA          NA         u026@example.c… Fini… 2 June 2021… #> 5 Huynh   Rohith       NA          NA         u024@example.c… Fini… 2 June 2021… #> 6 Ellis   Joy          NA          NA         u013@example.c… Fini… 2 June 2021… #> # … with 11 more variables: `Time taken` <chr>, Completed <chr>, #> #   `Grade/10.00` <dbl>, `Q. 1 /0.79` <dbl>, `Q. 2 /0.26` <dbl>, #> #   `Q. 3 /2.37` <dbl>, `Q. 4 /2.11` <dbl>, `Q. 5 /2.11` <dbl>, #> #   `Q. 6 /0.26` <dbl>, `Q. 7 /1.05` <chr>, `Q. 8 /1.05` <dbl> grades_ls$Quiz_1 %>%    select(Surname, starts_with("G"), starts_with("Q")) %>%    tail(1) #> # A tibble: 1 × 10 #>   Surname      `Grade/10.00` `Q. 1 /0.79` `Q. 2 /0.26` `Q. 3 /2.37` `Q. 4 /2.11` #>   <chr>                <dbl>        <dbl>        <dbl>        <dbl>        <dbl> #> 1 Overall ave…          9.55         0.64         0.26         2.28         2.02 #> # … with 4 more variables: `Q. 5 /2.11` <dbl>, `Q. 6 /0.26` <dbl>, #> #   `Q. 7 /1.05` <chr>, `Q. 8 /1.05` <dbl>

title: moodleQuiz
text: responses_ls list containing 2 data frames Moodle Responses Report. data frame quiz group students done.
code: names(responses_ls) #> [1] "Quiz_1" "Quiz_2" head(responses_ls$Quiz_1) #> # A tibble: 6 × 12 #>   Surname `First name` Institution Department `Email address` State `Started on` #>   <chr>   <chr>        <lgl>       <lgl>      <chr>           <chr> <chr>        #> 1 Xiong   Lance        NA          NA         u004@example.c… Fini… 19 April 20… #> 2 Halami… Sydney       NA          NA         u002@example.c… Fini… 19 April 20… #> 3 Palomi… Itzel        NA          NA         u016@example.c… Fini… 19 April 20… #> 4 el-Far… Hakam        NA          NA         u001@example.c… Fini… 19 April 20… #> 5 al-Far… Hamood       NA          NA         u012@example.c… Fini… 19 April 20… #> 6 Solis   Dominique    NA          NA         u007@example.c… Fini… 19 April 20… #> # … with 5 more variables: `Time taken` <chr>, Completed <chr>, #> #   `Grade/2.00` <chr>, `Response 1` <chr>, `Response 2` <chr>

title: moodleQuiz
text: check_sub() check student submission state column Grades Responses report. Calling function Clean format column names Encode State column resulting Encode column, “Finished” attempt encoded 1, “progress” attempt encoded 0. Filter rows time encoding. default, choose first maximum score student. Check Submission Quiz 1 Check Submission Quizzes can check whether student submit multiple quizzes passing list data frames show grades_ls. Notice name data frame (e.g., “Quiz_1”) prefix column names, Total column calculated sum encoding student quiz. Now can check whether students submit quizzes course many missed just calling one function!
code: grades_ls$Quiz_1 %>%   check_sub(id_regex = "[:digit:]+") %>%   select(Name, ID, State, Encode) #> # A tibble: 26 × 4 #>    Name               ID    State    Encode #>    <chr>              <chr> <chr>     <dbl> #>  1 Jada Roquemore     017   Finished      1 #>  2 Ronin Ali          001   Finished      1 #>  3 Jerry Hoffpauir    002   Finished      1 #>  4 Nathan Babbitt     026   Finished      1 #>  5 Rohith Huynh       024   Finished      1 #>  6 Joy Ellis          013   Finished      1 #>  7 Jeremy Nelson      023   Finished      1 #>  8 Christopher Dillon 003   Finished      1 #>  9 Israel Munoz       018   Finished      1 #> 10 Zubaida al-Attar   022   Finished      1 #> # … with 16 more rows grades_ls %>%   check_sub(id_regex = "[:digit:]+") %>%   select(Name, ID, ends_with("Encode"), Total) #> # A tibble: 26 × 6 #>    Name               ID    Quiz_1_Encode Quiz_2_Encode Quiz_3_Encode Total #>    <chr>              <chr>         <dbl>         <dbl>         <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 Jada Roquemore     017               1             1             1     3 #>  2 Ronin Ali          001               1             1             1     3 #>  3 Jerry Hoffpauir    002               1             1             1     3 #>  4 Nathan Babbitt     026               1             1             1     3 #>  5 Rohith Huynh       024               1             1             1     3 #>  6 Joy Ellis          013               1             1             1     3 #>  7 Jeremy Nelson      023               1             1             1     3 #>  8 Christopher Dillon 003               1             1             1     3 #>  9 Israel Munoz       018               1             1             1     3 #> 10 Zubaida al-Attar   022               1             1             1     3 #> # … with 16 more rows

title: moodleQuiz
text: combine_resp() combine student’s responses (Response x) Responses report. Calling function Clean format column names Filter rows time encoding. default, choose first maximum score student. Return data frame Response_x columns Combine Response Quiz 1 get similar result check_sub(), except also return Response_* column ability split Cloze columns. Combine Response Quizzes Calling combine_resp() list data frame get responses students combined 1 data frame. Notice name data frame (e.g., “Quiz_1”) prefix column names.
code: responses_ls$Quiz_1 %>%   combine_resp(id_regex = "[:digit:]+") %>%   select(Name, ID, starts_with("R")) #> # A tibble: 26 × 4 #>    Name             ID    Response_1                                  Response_2 #>    <chr>            <chr> <chr>                                       <chr>      #>  1 Lance Xiong      004   intuitively singled out as the instigator … she repli… #>  2 Sydney Halamicek 002   Tarzan’s face was a pathetic expression of… the means… #>  3 Itzel Palomino   016   not to harm you if you will return our ivo… -          #>  4 Hakam el-Farooq  001   “A derelict,” was the terse explanation of… “I fear,”… #>  5 Hamood al-Farha  012   At last they passed through two great wall… Finding t… #>  6 Dominique Solis  007   the powers of the ape-man and overestimate… though he… #>  7 Zhjade Alarid    009   upon the unsuspecting woman. A faint rustl… and fortu… #>  8 Jordan Tan       013   “In time to save you from death upon the a… warriors … #>  9 Kevin Vasquez    025   A FRIEND.                                   Thus, mak… #> 10 Angela Carrillo  018   very faithful and loyal wife, but as she h… “they wer… #> # … with 16 more rows responses_ls %>%   combine_resp(id_regex = "[:digit:]+") %>%   select(Name, ID, contains("R")) %>%   glimpse() #> Rows: 26 #> Columns: 7 #> $ Name              <chr> "Lance Xiong", "Sydney Halamicek", "Itzel Palomino",… #> $ ID                <chr> "004", "002", "016", "001", "012", "007", "009", "01… #> $ Quiz_1_Response_1 <chr> "intuitively singled out as the instigator of the ou… #> $ Quiz_1_Response_2 <chr> "she replied. “The thing that has just happened has … #> $ Quiz_2_Response_1 <chr> "The next day Thuran was worse. Almost constantly he… #> $ Quiz_2_Response_2 <chr> "you insisted it would have been too late to have re… #> $ Quiz_2_Response_3 <chr> "While Monsieur Flaubert spoke Tarzan selected a cig…

title: moodleQuiz
text: count_resp() counts many responses student answered Responses report. Calling function Clean format column names Filter rows time encoding. default, choose first maximum score student. Return data frame Count_Resp_x columns contrast combine_resp(), count_resp() returns counts many responses students answered. Beware count_resp() counts non-blank answers - (dash) answers, even though appropriate question. Count Responses Quiz 1 Count Responses Quizzes Calling count_resp() list data frame yields counts responses quizzes total counts calculated. Using count_resp() checking response counts can great way check whether student quiz expected, since checking done per questions, check_sub() check student’s submission quiz. Interestingly, student every questions quiz forgot press “Submit finished” button, result check_sub() shows student didn’t quiz (“progress”), count_resp() can reveal student quiz many questions answered.
code: responses_ls$Quiz_1 %>%   count_resp(id_regex = "[:digit:]+") %>%   select(Name, ID, starts_with("Count")) #> # A tibble: 26 × 3 #>    Name             ID    Count_Resp_2 #>    <chr>            <chr>        <int> #>  1 Lance Xiong      004              2 #>  2 Sydney Halamicek 002              2 #>  3 Itzel Palomino   016              1 #>  4 Hakam el-Farooq  001              2 #>  5 Hamood al-Farha  012              2 #>  6 Dominique Solis  007              2 #>  7 Zhjade Alarid    009              2 #>  8 Jordan Tan       013              2 #>  9 Kevin Vasquez    025              2 #> 10 Angela Carrillo  018              2 #> # … with 16 more rows responses_ls %>%   count_resp(id_regex = "[:digit:]+") %>%   select(Name, ID, contains("Count"), starts_with("Total")) #> # A tibble: 26 × 5 #>    Name             ID    Quiz_1_Count_Resp_2 Quiz_2_Count_Resp_3 Total_5 #>    <chr>            <chr>               <int>               <int>   <int> #>  1 Lance Xiong      004                     2                   3       5 #>  2 Sydney Halamicek 002                     2                   3       5 #>  3 Itzel Palomino   016                     1                   3       4 #>  4 Hakam el-Farooq  001                     2                   3       5 #>  5 Hamood al-Farha  012                     2                   3       5 #>  6 Dominique Solis  007                     2                   3       5 #>  7 Zhjade Alarid    009                     2                   2       4 #>  8 Jordan Tan       013                     2                   2       4 #>  9 Kevin Vasquez    025                     2                   3       5 #> 10 Angela Carrillo  018                     2                   2       4 #> # … with 16 more rows

title: moodleQuiz
text: combine_grades() filter, adjust, combine student’s grade Grade/xx column. Calling function Clean format column names Filter rows time grade. default, choose first maximum score student. Return data frame Grade_x columns (may Qx) Combine & Adjust Grades Quiz 1 can filter grade choose_grade parameter readjust maximum grade score new_max_grade parameter. Combine Grades Quizzes Calling combine_grades() list data frame combine score quizzes student 1 data frame, Total_x column added sum student’s score. can adjust maximum score individual quizzes input new_max_grade numeric vector corresponding quiz. example, adjust maximum score “Quiz_1” “Quiz_2” 25, “Quiz_3” 50. Last updated: 2022-06-02
code: grades_ls$Quiz_1 %>%   combine_grades(     id_regex = "[:digit:]+",     choose_grade = "max", # Choose only maximum grade of each student     new_max_grade = 100 # Adjust maximum grade to 100   ) %>%   select(Name, ID, starts_with("G"), starts_with("Q")) #> # A tibble: 26 × 11 #>    Name          ID    Grade_100    Q1    Q2    Q3    Q4    Q5    Q6    Q7    Q8 #>    <chr>         <chr>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 Jada Roquemo… 017        94.7   2.6   2.6  23.7  21.1  21.1   2.6  10.5  10.5 #>  2 Ronin Ali     001        97.4   7.9   2.6  23.7  21.1  21.1   2.6   7.9  10.5 #>  3 Jerry Hoffpa… 002        94.7   2.6   2.6  23.7  21.1  21.1   2.6  10.5  10.5 #>  4 Nathan Babbi… 026       100     7.9   2.6  23.7  21.1  21.1   2.6  10.5  10.5 #>  5 Rohith Huynh  024       100     7.9   2.6  23.7  21.1  21.1   2.6  10.5  10.5 #>  6 Joy Ellis     013       100     7.9   2.6  23.7  21.1  21.1   2.6  10.5  10.5 #>  7 Jeremy Nelson 023        92.1   7.9   2.6  21.1  15.8  21.1   2.6  10.5  10.5 #>  8 Christopher … 003        94.7   2.6   2.6  23.7  21.1  21.1   2.6  10.5  10.5 #>  9 Israel Munoz  018       100     7.9   2.6  23.7  21.1  21.1   2.6  10.5  10.5 #> 10 Zubaida al-A… 022       100     7.9   2.6  23.7  21.1  21.1   2.6  10.5  10.5 #> # … with 16 more rows grades_ls %>%   combine_grades(     id_regex = "[:digit:]+",     choose_grade = "max", # Choose only maximum grade of each student     new_max_grade = c(25, 25, 50) # Maximum score of each quizzes   ) %>%   select(Name, ID, contains("Grade"), starts_with("Total")) %>%   glimpse() #> Rows: 26 #> Columns: 6 #> $ Name            <chr> "Jada Roquemore", "Ronin Ali", "Jerry Hoffpauir", "Nat… #> $ ID              <chr> "017", "001", "002", "026", "024", "013", "023", "003"… #> $ Quiz_1_Grade_25 <dbl> 23.675, 24.350, 23.675, 25.000, 25.000, 25.000, 23.025… #> $ Quiz_2_Grade_25 <dbl> 19.425, 20.350, 16.650, 18.500, 25.000, 13.875, 25.000… #> $ Quiz_3_Grade_50 <dbl> 49.95, 46.40, 49.95, 49.95, 49.95, 49.95, 46.40, 49.95… #> $ Total_100       <dbl> 93.050, 91.100, 90.275, 93.450, 99.950, 88.825, 94.425…

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kittipos Sirivongrungson. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation

what: A High-level R Package for Manipulation of Moodle Quiz Report
title: A High-level R Package for Manipulation of Moodle Quiz Report
text: R package moodleQuiz contains high-level functions cleaning, encoding, filtering, combining student’s score responses Moodle Quiz report.

title: A High-level R Package for Manipulation of Moodle Quiz Report
text: can install development version GitHub :
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("Lightbridge-KS/moodleQuiz")

title: A High-level R Package for Manipulation of Moodle Quiz Report
text: 4 main functions moodleQuiz follows: check_sub(): check student’s submission Moodle quiz report looking state column. combine_resp(): combine student’s responses (Response x) Responses report. count_resp(): count many responses student answered Responses report. combine_grades(): filter, adjust, combine student’s grade Grade/xx column. theses 4 main functions generic function operate data frame list data frames Moodle Quiz report. latter particularly useful performing data aggregation across multiple Moodle quiz report type.

title: A High-level R Package for Manipulation of Moodle Quiz Report
text: long time ago, ’ve build Shiny app colleagues manipulate Moodle Quiz report. app grows bigger, realized separate business logic application logic, app can maintainable. Instead, ’ve focus writing functions, shift aim build system functions manipulate Moodle Quiz report easy possible R user. Afterwards, collection functions become moodleQuiz package drives logic shiny app facilitate process retrieve combine student’s score SELECx (Moodle platform Faculty Medicine Siriraj Hospital, Mahidol University, Thailand).

title: A High-level R Package for Manipulation of Moodle Quiz Report
text: Let’s say Moodle Grades Report data frame “Quiz_1” Combine & Adjust Grades Quiz 1 choose maximum score student readjust maximum grades 100? Calling combine_grades() one step, plus also cleans column names extracts numeric student ID Email address. Combine Grades Quizzes Supposed semester student graded assignment multiple quizzes, can put individual Grades Report list. Now ’s list data frames (grades_ls). Supply list data frames combine_grades(), can combine weight grades multiple quizzes one data frame sum student’s score Total_x column.
code: library(moodleQuiz) library(dplyr) glimpse(grades_ls$Quiz_1) #> Rows: 27 #> Columns: 18 #> $ Surname         <chr> "Roquemore", "Ali", "Hoffpauir", "Babbitt", "Huynh", "… #> $ `First name`    <chr> "Jada", "Ronin", "Jerry", "Nathan", "Rohith", "Joy", "… #> $ Institution     <lgl> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA… #> $ Department      <lgl> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA… #> $ `Email address` <chr> "u017@example.com", "u001@example.com", "u002@example.… #> $ State           <chr> "Finished", "Finished", "Finished", "Finished", "Finis… #> $ `Started on`    <chr> "2 June 2021 8:28 AM", "2 June 2021 2:21 PM", "2 June … #> $ `Time taken`    <chr> "16 mins 49 secs", "17 mins 11 secs", "11 mins 30 secs… #> $ Completed       <chr> "2 June 2021 8:45 AM", "2 June 2021 2:38 PM", "2 June … #> $ `Grade/10.00`   <dbl> 9.47, 9.74, 9.47, 10.00, 10.00, 10.00, 9.21, 9.47, 10.… #> $ `Q. 1 /0.79`    <dbl> 0.26, 0.79, 0.26, 0.79, 0.79, 0.79, 0.79, 0.26, 0.79, … #> $ `Q. 2 /0.26`    <dbl> 0.26, 0.26, 0.26, 0.26, 0.26, 0.26, 0.26, 0.26, 0.26, … #> $ `Q. 3 /2.37`    <dbl> 2.37, 2.37, 2.37, 2.37, 2.37, 2.37, 2.11, 2.37, 2.37, … #> $ `Q. 4 /2.11`    <dbl> 2.11, 2.11, 2.11, 2.11, 2.11, 2.11, 1.58, 2.11, 2.11, … #> $ `Q. 5 /2.11`    <dbl> 2.11, 2.11, 2.11, 2.11, 2.11, 2.11, 2.11, 2.11, 2.11, … #> $ `Q. 6 /0.26`    <dbl> 0.26, 0.26, 0.26, 0.26, 0.26, 0.26, 0.26, 0.26, 0.26, … #> $ `Q. 7 /1.05`    <chr> "1.05", "0.79", "1.05", "1.05", "1.05", "1.05", "1.05"… #> $ `Q. 8 /1.05`    <dbl> 1.05, 1.05, 1.05, 1.05, 1.05, 1.05, 1.05, 1.05, 1.05, … grades_ls$Quiz_1 %>%   combine_grades(     extract_id_from = "Email address", # Extract Student ID from Email     id_regex = "[:digit:]+", # Regular expression to extract student ID     choose_grade = "max", # Choose only maximum grade of each student     new_max_grade = 100 # Adjust maximum grade to 100   ) %>%   select(Name, ID, starts_with("G"), starts_with("Q")) #> # A tibble: 26 × 11 #>    Name          ID    Grade_100    Q1    Q2    Q3    Q4    Q5    Q6    Q7    Q8 #>    <chr>         <chr>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 Jada Roquemo… 017        94.7   2.6   2.6  23.7  21.1  21.1   2.6  10.5  10.5 #>  2 Ronin Ali     001        97.4   7.9   2.6  23.7  21.1  21.1   2.6   7.9  10.5 #>  3 Jerry Hoffpa… 002        94.7   2.6   2.6  23.7  21.1  21.1   2.6  10.5  10.5 #>  4 Nathan Babbi… 026       100     7.9   2.6  23.7  21.1  21.1   2.6  10.5  10.5 #>  5 Rohith Huynh  024       100     7.9   2.6  23.7  21.1  21.1   2.6  10.5  10.5 #>  6 Joy Ellis     013       100     7.9   2.6  23.7  21.1  21.1   2.6  10.5  10.5 #>  7 Jeremy Nelson 023        92.1   7.9   2.6  21.1  15.8  21.1   2.6  10.5  10.5 #>  8 Christopher … 003        94.7   2.6   2.6  23.7  21.1  21.1   2.6  10.5  10.5 #>  9 Israel Munoz  018       100     7.9   2.6  23.7  21.1  21.1   2.6  10.5  10.5 #> 10 Zubaida al-A… 022       100     7.9   2.6  23.7  21.1  21.1   2.6  10.5  10.5 #> # … with 16 more rows grades_ls %>%    purrr::map_lgl(is.data.frame) #> Quiz_1 Quiz_2 Quiz_3  #>   TRUE   TRUE   TRUE grades_ls %>%    combine_grades(     extract_id_from = "Email address", # Extract Student ID from Email     id_regex = "[:digit:]+", # Regular expression to extract student ID     choose_grade = "max", # Choose only maximum grade of each student     new_max_grade = c(25, 25, 50) # Adjust maximum grade to 100   ) %>%    select(Name, ID, contains("Grade"), starts_with("Total")) #> # A tibble: 26 × 6 #>    Name          ID    Quiz_1_Grade_25 Quiz_2_Grade_25 Quiz_3_Grade_50 Total_100 #>    <chr>         <chr>           <dbl>           <dbl>           <dbl>     <dbl> #>  1 Jada Roquemo… 017              23.7            19.4            50.0      93.1 #>  2 Ronin Ali     001              24.4            20.4            46.4      91.1 #>  3 Jerry Hoffpa… 002              23.7            16.6            50.0      90.3 #>  4 Nathan Babbi… 026              25              18.5            50.0      93.4 #>  5 Rohith Huynh  024              25              25              50.0     100.  #>  6 Joy Ellis     013              25              13.9            50.0      88.8 #>  7 Jeremy Nelson 023              23.0            25              46.4      94.4 #>  8 Christopher … 003              23.7            22.2            50.0      95.8 #>  9 Israel Munoz  018              25              21.3            50.0      96.2 #> 10 Zubaida al-A… 022              25              22.2            50.0      97.2 #> # title: A High-level R Package for Manipulation of Moodle Quiz Report
text: Get started Last updated: 2022-06-02

title: Check Student Submission — check_sub
text: check_sub() generic function check student submission(s) Moodle Quiz report(s) (.e. Grades Responses report). function can encode & filter student's attempts state (.e., "Finished" "progress") started time ("Started " column). function also cleans column names Moodle Quiz report easier manipulation, extracts student ID "Email address" column using regular expression, unites "First name" "Surname" column "Name".

title: Check Student Submission — check_sub
code: check_sub(   data,   extract_id_from = c("Email address", "Institution", "Department", "ID number"),   id_regex = ".*",   sep_name = " ",   state = c("Finished", "In progress"),   encode = c(1, 0),   choose_encode = c("max", "min", "all"),   choose_time = c("first", "last", "all"),   ... )

title: Check Student Submission — check_sub
text: data data.frame named list data.frame Moodle Quiz report(s) (.e. either Grades Responses report). extract_id_from (Character) Choose 1 column extract ID id_regex (Character) regular expression used extract ID column (choose one) "Email address", "Institution", "Department", "ID number" Moodle Quiz report. default ".*" meaning characters. student email addresses numeric IDs , try "[:digit:]+" extract digits email. Note: Regular expression syntax stringr. sep_name character new "Name" column separate original "First name" "Surname". state character vector match values "State" column Moodle Quiz report encode encoding numeric vector corresponding state. example: default, "State" column, "Finished" values encoded 1, "progress" encoded 0. choose_encode character filter student's attempt encodeing. "max" (default): return rows maximum encoding students. "min": return rows minimum encoding students. "": filter applied, return rows. choose_time character filter student's attempt started time (determined "Started " column Moodle Quiz report). filter applies choose_encode applied data. "first" (default): return rows represent first attempt students. "last": return rows represent last attempt students. "": filter applied, return rows applying choose_encode ... argument sep_col check_sub.list(), indicates character separation names list "state" "encode" columns.

title: Check Student Submission — check_sub
text: data.frame, output content determined class first argument: data. data data.frame; output encoded, filtered, cleaned data.frame Moodle Quiz report. data named list data.frame; output previously described, Moodle Quiz reports full-joined together column "Name" "ID". , new column "Total" computed sum "...State" columns.

title: Check Student Submission — check_sub

title: Clean Moodle Quiz report — clean_moodle
text: Clean Moodle Quiz report easier manipulation R. extracts student ID "Email address" column; unites "First name" "Surname" column; converts dash ("-"), can presented student given answer, NA; forces "Grade" "Q. x /x" numeric value ("yet graded", "Requires grading", "-" presented NA).

title: Clean Moodle Quiz report — clean_moodle
code: clean_moodle(   data,   extract_id = TRUE,   extract_id_from = c("Email address", "Institution", "Department", "ID number"),   id_regex = ".*",   sep_name = " ",   dash_na = TRUE,   force_numeric = TRUE )

title: Clean Moodle Quiz report — clean_moodle
text: data data.frame Moodle Quiz report. extract_id (Logical) TRUE: "ID" column created extracting characters "Email address" column using regular expression id_regex. FALSE: "Email address" column renamed "Email". extract_id_from (Character) Choose column extract ID one : "Email address", "Institution", "Department", "ID number" (custom one). id_regex (Character) Regular expression used extract ID "Email address". default ".*" meaning characters. student email addresses numeric IDs , try "[:digit:]+" extract digits email. Note: Regular expression syntax stringr. sep_name (Character) character new "Name" column separate original "First name" "Surname". dash_na (Logical) TRUE: format dash "-" columns NA. FALSE: leave dash "-" force_numeric (Logical) TRUE: force "Grade" "Q. x /x" columns numeric type ("yet graded", "Requires grading", "-" presented NA). FALSE: leave "Grade" "Q. x /x" columns .

title: Clean Moodle Quiz report — clean_moodle
text: data.frame cleaner column names better formatted data. Although column names cleaned, metadata lost maximum score quiz questions. Check get_quiz_attr() get metadata.

title: Combine Grades — combine_grades
text: combine_grades() generic function combine, adjust, filter student grades Moodle Grades report(s) (Responses report). function can combine "Grade/xx" columns multiple Moodle Grades reports single data.frame. Furthermore, can adjust weight maximum score quizzes "Total" score computed. report contains multiple attempts per student, can also filter grades student score ("Grade/xx" column) start time ("Started " column), e.g. first best score students. Like check_sub(), function also cleans column names easy manipulation, extracts student ID "Email address", unites "First name" "Surname" column "Name".

title: Combine Grades — combine_grades
code: combine_grades(   data,   extract_id_from = c("Email address", "Institution", "Department", "ID number"),   id_regex = ".*",   sep_name = " ",   new_max_grade = NULL,   round_digits = 3,   choose_grade = c("max", "min", "mean", "all"),   choose_time = c("first", "last", "all"),   force_grade = F,   sep_col = "_" )

title: Combine Grades — combine_grades
text: data data.frame named list data.frame Moodle Grades report(s) (Responses report) extract_id_from (Character) Choose 1 column extract ID id_regex (Character) regular expression used extract ID column "Email address" Moodle Quiz report. default ".*" meaning characters. student email addresses numeric IDs , try "[:digit:]+" extract digits email. Note: Regular expression syntax stringr. sep_name character new "Name" column separate original "First name" "Surname". new_max_grade (Numeric) desired new maximum grade(s) adjust. NULL (default): new maximum grade /equal old maximum grade Moodle Grades report ("Grade/xx" columns). Note: new maximum grade appended "Grade_*" column names. data data.frame; enter new_max_grade length 1 numeric vector indicate new maximum grade quiz. data named list data.frame; enter new_max_grade numeric vector indicate new maximum grades corresponding quizzes (element list data.frame). Length new_max_grade must equal length list data.frame. round_digits Length 1 numeric vector indicate digits round grades. NULL: round digits. choose_grade character filter student's attempt score ("Grade/xx" column), useful quiz multiple attempts students. "max" (default): return rows maximum score students. "min": return rows minimum score students. "mean": compute return mean score students. "": filter applied, return rows. choose_time character filter student's attempt started time (determined "Started " column). filter applies choose_grade applied data. "first" (default): return rows represent first attempt students. "last": return rows represent last attempt students. "": filter applied, return rows applying choose_grade force_grade (Logical) grade students found "yet graded", get error message. purpose warn might forgotten grade students. want bypass behavior, set force_grade = TRUE. sep_col (Character) data named list data.frame, sep_col indicate character separation names list "State" "Grade" columns.

title: Combine Grades — combine_grades
text: data.frame, output content determined class first argument: data. data data.frame; output cleaned data.frame Moodle Grades report, whether adjusted filtered depends arguments. data named list data.frame; output previously described, Moodle Grades reports full-joined together column "Name" "ID". , "Grades_" columns data.frame sit together single data.frame, "Total_" column added last column indicate sum quizzes grades.

title: Combine Student's Responses — combine_resp
text: combine_resp() generic function combine student responses Moodle Responses report(s) (Grades report). Moodle responses report response column(s) contained embedded answers (Cloze), option split different parts (one column ). functionality similar check_sub() : encode & filter student's attempts state (.e., "Finished" "progress") started time ("Started " column), cleans column names easy manipulation, extracts student ID "Email address", unites "First name" "Surname" column "Name".

title: Combine Student's Responses — combine_resp
code: combine_resp(   data,   extract_id_from = c("Email address", "Institution", "Department", "ID number"),   id_regex = ".*",   sep_name = " ",   state = c("Finished", "In progress"),   encode = c(1, 0),   choose_encode = c("max", "min", "all"),   choose_time = c("first", "last", "all"),   split_cloze = F,   part_glue = "_part_",   sep_col = "_p_" )

title: Combine Student's Responses — combine_resp
text: data data.frame named list data.frame Moodle Responses report(s) (Grades report) extract_id_from (Character) Choose 1 column extract ID id_regex (Character) regular expression used extract ID column "Email address" Moodle Quiz report. default ".*" meaning characters. student email addresses numeric IDs , try "[:digit:]+" extract digits email. Note: Regular expression syntax stringr. sep_name character new "Name" column separate original "First name" "Surname". state character vector match values "State" column Moodle Quiz report encode encoding numeric vector corresponding state. example: default, "State" column, "Finished" values encoded 1, "progress" encoded 0. choose_encode character filter student's attempt encodeing. "max" (default): return rows maximum encoding students. "min": return rows minimum encoding students. "": filter applied, return rows. choose_time character filter student's attempt started time (determined "Started " column Moodle Quiz report). filter applies choose_encode applied data. "first" (default): return rows represent first attempt students. "last": return rows represent last attempt students. "": filter applied, return rows applying choose_encode split_cloze (Logical) data least one response column(s) contained embedded answers (Cloze), split_cloze = TRUE split different parts (one column ). data Cloze response columns, split_cloze = TRUE result error message. FALSE (default), Cloze column split. part_glue (Character) split_cloze = TRUE cloze response columns presented, part_glue represent character glues names "Response" column "Parts" Cloze columns together. sep_col (Character) data named list data.frame, sep_col indicate character separation names list "State" "Response" columns.

title: Combine Student's Responses — combine_resp
text: data.frame, output content determined class first argument: data. data data.frame; output encoded, filtered, cleaned data.frame Moodle Responses report. data named list data.frame; output previously described, Moodle Quiz reports full-joined together column "Name" "ID". , "Response" columns data.frame sit together single data.frame. resulting response columns format (default): "<listNames>-Responses-<number>"

title: Count Student's Answers — count_answers
text: count_answers() counts student's answers every "Response" columns Moodle Responses report(s). Answers Moodle's quiz can one 3 types: single answered, multiple answered, embedded answers (Cloze). answers types formatted differently "Response" column. count_answers() knows type answers count answers best counting method thinks.

title: Count Student's Answers — count_answers
code: count_answers(   data,   count_type = c("auto", "single", "multi", "cloze"),   sort = TRUE,   round_digits = 2 )

title: Count Student's Answers — count_answers
text: data data.frame Moodle Responses report(s) (Grades report) count_type character indicate type counting methods. Must one : "auto" (default): function detects type questions automatically choose best counting method thinks type. "single": simply count answers assuming question single answer type. question multiple answers type, counts every combinations answers returned. "multi": question multiple answers type, give count answers. "cloze": question embedded answers (Cloze), give count every "Parts" Cloze question pooled together. sort (Logical) TRUE: sort counted results round_digits Integer round counted percentage NULL round.

title: Count Student's Answers — count_answers
text: data.frame

title: Count Student's Responses — count_resp
text: count_resp() generic function count responses per student Moodle Responses report(s) (Grades report). Similar combine_resp(), Moodle responses report response column(s) contained embedded answers (Cloze), option count whole (1 Cloze column = 1 count) individual parts (count parts Cloze column, individually). functionality similar check_sub() : encode & filter student's attempts state (.e., "Finished" "progress") started time ("Started " column), cleans column names easy manipulation, extracts student ID "Email address", unites "First name" "Surname" column "Name".

title: Count Student's Responses — count_resp
code: count_resp(   data,   extract_id_from = c("Email address", "Institution", "Department", "ID number"),   id_regex = ".*",   sep_name = " ",   state = c("Finished", "In progress"),   encode = c(1, 0),   choose_encode = c("max", "min", "all"),   choose_time = c("first", "last", "all"),   count_cloze_parts = F,   filter_count = c("max", "all"),   sep_col = "_" )

title: Count Student's Responses — count_resp
text: data data.frame named list data.frame Moodle Responses report(s) (Grades report) extract_id_from (Character) Choose 1 column extract ID id_regex (Character) regular expression used extract ID column "Email address" Moodle Quiz report. default ".*" meaning characters. student email addresses numeric IDs , try "[:digit:]+" extract digits email. Note: Regular expression syntax stringr. sep_name character new "Name" column separate original "First name" "Surname". state character vector match values "State" column Moodle Quiz report encode encoding numeric vector corresponding state. example: default, "State" column, "Finished" values encoded 1, "progress" encoded 0. choose_encode character filter student's attempt encodeing. "max" (default): return rows maximum encoding students. "min": return rows minimum encoding students. "": filter applied, return rows. choose_time character filter student's attempt started time (determined "Started " column Moodle Quiz report). filter applies choose_encode applied data. "first" (default): return rows represent first attempt students. "last": return rows represent last attempt students. "": filter applied, return rows applying choose_encode count_cloze_parts (Logical) Moodle Responses report least one response column(s) contained embedded answers (Cloze), set count_cloze_parts = TRUE count individual parts Cloze columns. FALSE, count Cloze column 1 count. filter_count (Character) One "max" "". filter option apply filter choose_encode choose_time. "max": filter rows maximum response count per student. ≥ 1 rows, filter first one based Started. "": filter apply. sep_col (Character) data named list data.frame, sep_col indicate character separation names list "State" "Count_resp" columns.

title: Count Student's Responses — count_resp
text: data.frame, output content determined class first argument: data. data data.frame; output encoded, filtered, cleaned data.frame Moodle Responses report. "Count_resp" column added maximum number count appended column name. data named list data.frame; output previously described, Moodle Quiz reports full-joined together column "Name" "ID". , "Count_resp" columns data.frame sit together single data.frame, "Total" column added last column indicate total count.

title: Count Student's Responses — count_resp

title: Get Moodle Quiz Attributes — get_quiz_attr
text: Get attributes meta-information Moodle Quiz report (.e., Grades Responses report) type Moodle Quiz report, maximum grade quiz, question's number, question's maximum score, embedded answer (Cloze) column names (present).

title: Get Moodle Quiz Attributes — get_quiz_attr
code: get_quiz_attr(data)

title: Get Moodle Quiz Attributes — get_quiz_attr
text: data data.frame Moodle Quiz report.

title: Get Moodle Quiz Attributes — get_quiz_attr
text: List containing Quiz attributes : report_type: (character) "Grades" Moodle Grade report "Responses" Moodle Responses report. some_nyg: (logical) TRUE: "Grade/xx" column Moodle Quiz report contained grades "yet graded". FALSE: "Grade/xx" column contained numeric grades. grade_max: (numeric) Maximum grade Quiz q_no: (numeric) report_type "Grades", q_no shows questions number presented Moodle Grades report. q_max: (numeric) report_type "Grades", q_max shows maximum scores corresponding q_no. resp_no: (numeric)  report_type "Responses", resp_no shows responses number Moodle Responses report. cloze_cols: (character) report_type "Responses", cloze_cols shows names "Responses" column contained embedded answer (Cloze). Cloze column presented, return NULL.

title: Get Moodle Quiz Attributes — get_quiz_attr
code: # Grades Report get_quiz_attr(grades_ls$Quiz_1) #> $report_type #> [1] "Grades" #>  #> $some_nyg #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $grade_max #> [1] 10 #>  #> $q_no #> [1] 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 #>  #> $q_max #> [1] 0.79 0.26 2.37 2.11 2.11 0.26 1.05 1.05 #>   # Responses Report get_quiz_attr(responses_ls$Quiz_1) #> $report_type #> [1] "Responses" #>  #> $some_nyg #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $grade_max #> [1] 2 #>  #> $resp_no #> [1] 1 2 #>  #> $cloze_cols #> NULL #>

title: Moodle Grades Report Example — grades_ls
text: Example Moodle Grades report. Student's scores retrieved form real world data, student names, email address time randomly simulated.

title: Moodle Grades Report Example — grades_ls
code: grades_ls

title: Moodle Grades Report Example — grades_ls
text: named list 3 data.frame following columns: "Surname": surname students (real) "First name": first name students (real) "Institution": NAs "Department": NAs "Email address": Student's email address numeric student ID . "State": State quiz "Started ": Quiz start time "Time taken": Elapsed time "Completed": Quiz end time "Grade/x": Student's score "x" indicate quiz maximum "Q. n /x": Score questions; "n" indicate question number, "x" indicate maximum questions.

what: moodleQuiz: A High-level R Package for Manipulation of Moodle Quiz Report — moodleQuiz-package
title: moodleQuiz: A High-level R Package for Manipulation of Moodle Quiz Report — moodleQuiz-package
text: Provide high-level ready--use functions data wrangling (.e., cleaning, filtering, encoding) combining Moodle Quiz Report (Grades Report Responses Report).

title: moodleQuiz: A High-level R Package for Manipulation of Moodle Quiz Report — moodleQuiz-package
text: Maintainer: Kittipos Sirivongrungson kittipos.sir@mahidol.edu

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: See magrittr::%>% details.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
code: lhs %>% rhs

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: result calling rhs(lhs).

title: Moodle Responses Report Example — responses_ls
text: Example Moodle Responses report. data entirely simulated. texts Response x columns randomly selected "Return Tarzan" Burroughs, Edgar Rice.

title: Moodle Responses Report Example — responses_ls
code: responses_ls

title: Moodle Responses Report Example — responses_ls
text: named list 2 data.frame following columns: "Surname": surname students (real) "First name": first name students (real) "Institution": NAs "Department": NAs "Email address": Student's email address numeric student ID . "State": State quiz "Started ": Quiz start time "Time taken": Elapsed time "Completed": Quiz end time "Grade/x": Student's score "x" indicate quiz maximum "Response x": Essay responses student

title: moodleQuiz 0.1.0 🎓 🎉
text: high-level data manipulation R package 📦 cleaning, encoding, filtering, combining student’s score responses Moodle Quiz report.

title: moodleQuiz 0.1.0 🎓 🎉
text: 4 main functions : check_sub(): check student’s submission Moodle quiz report looking state column. combine_resp(): combine student’s responses (Response x) Responses report. count_resp(): count many responses student answered Responses report. combine_grades(): filter, adjust, combine student’s grade Grade/xx column.

title: moodleQuiz 0.1.0 🎓 🎉
text: get_quiz_attr(): get meta-information Moodle Quiz report

title: moodleQuiz 0.1.0 🎓 🎉
text: clean_moodle(): clean Moodle Quiz report get_report_type(): check types Moodle Quiz report whether Grades Responses report.

title: moodleQuiz 0.1.0 🎓 🎉
text: grades_ls: Moodle Grades Report Example responses_ls: Moodle Responses Report Example

title: moodleQuiz 0.0.0.9000
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
